citations.narrative:
Space. Inadequate space was being provided to enclosures housing weanling guinea pigs. Two orange weanling
enclosures each measure 24 inches wide by 78 inches long or 1872 square inches of floor space. The top enclosure was
housing at least 40 weanlings and the bottom enclosure was housing at least 38 weanlings. Can not house more than
31weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams in this size enclosure.
In addition, there were 4 weanling enclosures housed in the wire enclosures with black plastic pans with inadequate
space. These four enclosure each measure 32 inches by 20 inches or 640 square inches of floor space. These
enclosures had 12, 14, 15, and 18 weanlings present. Can not house more than 10 weanling guinea pigs weighing up to
350 guinea pigs in this size enclosure.
Inadequate space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can lead to bites, scratches, ear chewing
and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space
per animal to prevent overcrowding. Remains uncorrected.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.28(c)(1)(iii)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
Space. Inadequate space was being provided to enclosures housing weanling guinea pigs. Two orange weanling 
enclosures each measure 24 inches wide by 78 inches long or 1872 square inches of floor space. The top enclosure was 
housing at least 40 weanlings and the bottom enclosure was housing at least 38 weanlings. Can not house more than 
31weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams in this size enclosure. 
 
In addition, there were 4 weanling enclosures housed in the wire enclosures with black plastic pans with inadequate 
space. These four enclosure each measure 32 inches by 20 inches or 640 square inches of floor space. These 
enclosures had 12, 14, 15, and 18 weanlings present. Can not house more than 10 weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 
350 guinea pigs in this size enclosure.  
 
Inadequate space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can lead to bites, scratches, ear chewing 
and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space 
per animal to prevent overcrowding. Remains uncorrected. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
